content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Stone Furnace Smelting Setup at position (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at (41.0, -82.0) processing ores.
• Burner Inserter at (41.5, -83.5) transferring furnace output.
• Wooden Chest at (41.5, -84.5) storing processed items.
• Wooden Chest at (42.5, -81.5) serving as additional storage.

### Lab Setup at position (45.5, -79.5)
Consists of:
• Lab at (45.5, -79.5) receiving automation science packs for research (electrical connection now shows ID 87).

### Boiler and Steam Engine Production Setup
Consists of:
• Boiler at (42.5, -79.0) fueled with wood, with connection points at (40.5, -78.5) and (44.5, -78.5) and a steam output at (42.5, -81.0). It continues to flag warnings for missing input liquid and connection issues.
• Steam Engine (Generator) placed at (48.5, -75.5) with associated connection points at (48.5, -78.0) and (48.5, -73.0); it is not receiving power and displays warnings on missing liquid and unconnected connections.

### Electricity Pole Network
Consists of:
• Small Electric Pole positioned at (48.5, -79.5) adjacent to the Lab.
• Small Electric Pole positioned at (46.5, -75.5) adjacent to the Generator.
• ElectricityGroup connecting poles at positions (46.5, -75.5), (48.5, -79.5) and (48.5, -80.5).

### Offshore Pump Water Supply Setup
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump placed at (-17.5, 26.5) with a connection point at (-17.5, 25.5) and warnings indicating missing fluid connections.
• PipeGroup at approximately (-15.5, 23.5) linking the offshore pump to the boiler’s intended water input; the fluid system registers water output.

ERROR TIPS
• Timeout and Undefined Reference – Ensure that evaluation steps complete within time limits and that all referenced variables (e.g. boiler vs. boiler_entity) are correctly defined prior to use.
• Entity Placement Collisions – When placing entities such as electric poles or offshore pumps, verify that the target locations are free of obstructions and adjust spacing or reference positions as needed.
• Insufficient Inventory for Connections – Verify inventory for required items before attempting connection operations; errors in connecting poles or pipes often stem from missing necessary items.
• Resource Acquisition and Crafting Failures – Address crafting failures by ensuring availability of all required sub-ingredients (e.g. iron-plate, iron-gear-wheel, copper-plate, copper-cable, electronic-circuit) and by confirming that production facilities (smelting setups or crafting machines) are properly configured.
• Mismatched Resource Queries – When querying resources (like water patches), use the correct entity references and check that the queried location actually contains the resource.
